co.louiscap.lib.compat.output

Class MultiplexedStringPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.louiscap.lib.compat.output.MultiplexedStringPrinter

  • public class MultiplexedStringPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for printing strings to multiple different streams

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiplexedStringPrinter()
      Creates a new empty MultiplexedStringPrinter, useful for printing one string to multiple output sources
      MultiplexedStringPrinter(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.io.PrintStream> channels)
      Creates a new MultiplexedStringPrinter based on an existing HashMap, useful for printing one string to multiple output sources

      • MultiplexedStringPrinter

        public MultiplexedStringPrinter(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.io.PrintStream> channels)
        Creates a new MultiplexedStringPrinter based on an existing HashMap, useful for printing one string to multiple output sources
        Parameters:
        channels - A HashMap containing tagged print streams to form the basis of this printer

    • Method Detail

      • addChannel

        public void addChannel(java.lang.String tag,
                       java.io.PrintStream channel)
        Add a new output that can be written to.
        Parameters:
        tag - A unique name for this print stream, so that it can be issued individual commands
        channel - The print stream to add to this String Printer

      • removeChannels

        public void removeChannels(java.lang.String... tags)
        Remove one or more print stream(s) from this String Printer if it is no longer needed
        Parameters:
        tags - The names of the channels to remove

        PrintStream.println(java.lang.String)

      • println

        public void println(java.lang.String s,
                    java.lang.String... tags)
        Print a string and then a newline to the specified channels in this MultiplexedStringPrinter
        Parameters:
        s - The string to print out
        tags - The names of the channels to print to. Null channels will be ignored
        See Also:
        PrintStream.println(java.lang.String)

      • close

        public void close()
        Close all the print streams in this MultiplexedStringPrinter and flush their contents
        See Also:
        PrintStream.close()

        public void close(java.lang.String... tags)
        Close the specified print streams in this MultiplexedStringPrinter and flush their contents
        Parameters:
        tags - The names of the print streams to close
        See Also:
        PrintStream.close()

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flush the contents of all print streams in this MultiplexedStringPrinter
        See Also:

      • flush

        public void flush(java.lang.String... tags)
        Flush the contents of the specified print streams in this MultiplexedStringPrinter
        Parameters:
        tags - The names of the print streams to flush
        See Also:
        PrintStream.flush()

      • getBatch

        public MultiplexedStringPrinter getBatch(java.lang.String... tags)
        Gets a subset of the current print streams in this MultiplexedStringPrinter and returns them wrapped in a new MultiplexedStringPrinter.
        For example, if you had a MultiplexedStringPrinter with 15 channels, but only wanted to print to three labelled "out", "debug" and "file" repeatedly without having to provide the tags every time, you could batch them into their own MultiplexedStringPrinter and call the bare methods such as print(String) and flush() by calling example.getBatch("out", "debug", "file")
        Parameters:
        tags - The names of the channels to batch
        Returns:
        A new MultiplexedStringPrinter containing only the specified print streams
